member.name: T:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonNumberHandling
member.summary:
Determines how handles numbers when serializing and deserializing.
The behavior of and is not defined by the JSON specification. Altering the default number handling can potentially produce JSON that cannot be parsed by other JSON implementations.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonNumberHandling.Strict
member.summary: Numbers will only be read from tokens and will only be written as JSON numbers (without quotes).

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonNumberHandling.AllowReadingFromString
member.summary: Numbers can be read from tokens. Does not prevent numbers from being read from token. Strings that have escaped characters will be unescaped before reading. Leading or trailing trivia within the string token, including whitespace, is not allowed.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonNumberHandling.WriteAsString
member.summary:
Numbers will be written as JSON strings (with quotes), not as JSON numbers.
This behavior is not defined by the JSON specification. Altering the default number handling can potentially produce JSON that cannot be parsed by other JSON implementations.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonNumberHandling.AllowNamedFloatingPointLiterals
member.summary:
The "NaN", "Infinity", and "-Infinity" tokens can be read as floating-point constants, and the and values for these constants (such as and ) will be written as their corresponding JSON string representations. Strings that have escaped characters will be unescaped before reading. Leading or trailing trivia within the string token, including whitespace, is not allowed.
This behavior is not defined by the JSON specification. Altering the default number handling can potentially produce JSON that cannot be parsed by other JSON implementations.

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.Serialization.JsonExtensionDataAttribute
member.summary: When placed on a property or field of type or , any properties that do not have a matching property or field are added during deserialization and written during serialization.
member.remarks:
When using , the TKey value must be and TValue must be or .
During deserializing with a extension property with TValue as , the type of object created will either be a or a depending on the value of .
If a is created, a "null" JSON value is treated as a JsonElement with set to , otherwise a "null" JSON value is treated as a null object reference.
During serializing, the name of the extension data member is not included in the JSON; the data contained within the extension data is serialized as properties of the JSON object.
If there is more than one extension member on a type, or the member is not of the correct type, an is thrown during the first serialization or deserialization of that type.

member.summary: Indicates that the property or field should be included for serialization and deserialization.
member.remarks:
When applied to a public property, indicates that non-public getters and setters should be used for serialization and deserialization.
Non-public properties and fields are not allowed when serializing and deserializing. If the attribute is used on a non-public property or field, an is thrown during the first serialization or deserialization of the declaring type.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.JsonTypeInfoResolver.Combine(System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.IJsonTypeInfoResolver[])
member.summary: Combines multiple sources into one.
member.param: Sequence of contract resolvers to be queried for metadata.
member.returns: A combining results from .
member.exception: or any of its elements is null.
member.remarks:
The combined resolver will query each of in the specified order, returning the first result that is non-null. If all return null, then the combined resolver will also return .
Can be used to combine multiple sources, which typically define contract metadata for small subsets of types. It can also be used to fall back to wherever necessary.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.JsonTypeInfo.Properties
member.summary: Gets the list of metadata corresponding to the current type.
member.remarks:
Property is only applicable to metadata of kind . For other kinds an empty, read-only list will be returned.
The order of entries in the list determines the serialization order, unless either of the entries specifies a non-zero value, in which case the properties will be stable sorted by .
It is required that added entries are unique up to , however this will only be validated on serialization, once the metadata instance gets locked for further modification.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.JsonTypeInfo.Converter
member.summary: Gets the associated with the current type.
member.remarks: The associated with the type determines the value of , and by extension the types of metadata that are configurable in the current JSON contract. As such, the value of the converter cannot be changed once a instance has been created.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.JsonTypeInfo.Kind
member.summary: Determines the kind of contract metadata that the current instance is specifying.
member.remarks:
The value of determines what aspects of the JSON contract are configurable. For example, it is only possible to configure the list for metadata of kind .
The value of is determined exclusively by the resolved for the current type, and cannot be changed once resolution has happened. User-defined custom converters (specified either via or ) are metadata-agnostic and thus always resolve to .

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Serialization.Metadata.JsonTypeInfo.PropertyInfoForTypeInfo
member.summary: The JsonPropertyInfo for this JsonTypeInfo. It is used to obtain the converter for the TypeInfo.
member.remarks: The returned JsonPropertyInfo does not represent a real property; instead it represents either: a collection element type, a generic type parameter, a property type (if pushed to a new stack frame), or the root type passed into the root serialization APIs. For example, for a property returning where T is a string, a JsonTypeInfo will be created with .Type=typeof(string) and .PropertyInfoForTypeInfo=JsonPropertyInfo{string}. Without this property, a "Converter" property would need to be added to JsonTypeInfo and there would be several more `if` statements to obtain the converter from either the actual JsonPropertyInfo (for a real property) or from the TypeInfo (for the cases mentioned above). In addition, methods that have a JsonPropertyInfo argument would also likely need to add an argument for JsonTypeInfo.

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.Serialization.ReferenceHandler
member.summary: This class defines how the deals with references on serialization and deserialization.

member.summary: Indicates whether this ReferenceHandler implementation should use semantics or semantics. The defualt is Preserve.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Serialization.ReferenceHandler.Preserve
member.summary: Metadata properties will be honored when deserializing JSON objects and arrays into reference types and written when serializing reference types. This is necessary to create round-trippable JSON from objects that contain cycles or duplicate references.
member.remarks: * On Serialize: When writing complex reference types, the serializer also writes metadata properties (`$id`, `$values`, and `$ref`) within them. The output JSON will contain an extra `$id` property for every object, and for every enumerable type the JSON array emitted will be nested within a JSON object containing an `$id` and `$values` property. is used to determine whether objects are identical. When an object is identical to a previously serialized one, a pointer (`$ref`) to the identifier (`$id`) of such object is written instead. No metadata properties are written for value types. * On Deserialize: The metadata properties within the JSON that are used to preserve duplicated references and cycles will be honored as long as they are well-formed**. For JSON objects that don't contain any metadata properties, the deserialization behavior is identical to . For value types: * The `$id` metadata property is ignored. * A is thrown if a `$ref` metadata property is found within the JSON object. * For enumerable value types, the `$values` metadata property is ignored. ** For the metadata properties within the JSON to be considered well-formed, they must follow these rules: 1) The `$id` metadata property must be the first property in the JSON object. 2) A JSON object that contains a `$ref` metadata property must not contain any other properties. 3) The value of the `$ref` metadata property must refer to an `$id` that has appeared earlier in the JSON. 4) The value of the `$id` and `$ref` metadata properties must be a JSON string. 5) For enumerable types, such as , the JSON array must be nested within a JSON object containing an `$id` and `$values` metadata property, in that order. 6) For enumerable types, the `$values` metadata property must be a JSON array. 7) The `$values` metadata property is only valid when referring to enumerable types. If the JSON is not well-formed, a is thrown.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.JsonHelpers.TryParseDateTimeOffset(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Text.Json.JsonHelpers.DateTimeParseData@)
member.summary: ISO 8601 date time parser (ISO 8601-1:2019).
member.param: The date/time to parse in UTF-8 format.
The parsed for the given .
member.remarks:
Supports extended calendar date (5.2.2.1) and complete (5.4.2.1) calendar date/time of day representations with optional specification of seconds and fractional seconds.
Times can be explicitly specified as UTC ("Z" - 5.3.3) or offsets from UTC ("+/-hh:mm" 5.3.4.2). If unspecified they are considered to be local per spec.
Examples: (TZD is either "Z" or hh:mm offset from UTC)
YYYY-MM-DD (eg 1997-07-16) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm (eg 1997-07-16T19:20) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:30) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.s (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:30.45) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mmTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20+01:00) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:3001:00) YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sTZD (eg 1997-07-16T19:20:30.45Z)
Generally speaking we always require the "extended" option when one exists (3.1.3.5). The extended variants have separator characters between components ('-', ':', '.', etc.). Spaces are not permitted.
member.returns: "true" if successfully parsed.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.JsonDocument.TryParseValue(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@,System.Text.Json.JsonDocument@)
member.summary: Attempts to parse one JSON value (including objects or arrays) from the provided reader.
member.param: The reader to read.
Receives the parsed document.

remarks.para: If the property of is or , the reader will be advanced by one call to to determine the start of the value.

Upon completion of this method, will be positioned at the final token in the JSON value. If an exception is thrown, or is returned, the reader is reset to the state it was in when the method was called.
This method makes a copy of the data the reader acted on, so there is no caller requirement to maintain data integrity beyond the return of this method.

member.exception: is using unsupported options.
The current token does not start or represent a value.
A value could not be read from the reader.

member.summary: Returns an enumerator that iterates the properties of an object.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.JsonElement.ParseValue(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@)
member.summary: Parses one JSON value (including objects or arrays) from the provided reader.
member.param: The reader to read.
member.returns: A JsonElement representing the value (and nested values) read from the reader.

remarks.para: If the property of is or , the reader will be advanced by one call to to determine the start of the value.
Upon completion of this method, will be positioned at the final token in the JSON value. If an exception is thrown, the reader is reset to the state it was in when the method was called.
This method makes a copy of the data the reader acted on, so there is no caller requirement to maintain data integrity beyond the return of this method.

member.exception: is using unsupported options.
The current token does not start or represent a value.
A value could not be read from the reader.

remarks.para: If the property of is or , the reader will be advanced by one call to to determine the start of the value.

This method makes a copy of the data the reader acted on, so there is no caller requirement to maintain data integrity beyond the return of this method.

member.exception: is using unsupported options.

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.JsonCommentHandling
member.summary: This enum defines the various ways the can deal with comments.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.JsonCommentHandling.Disallow
member.summary: By default, do no allow comments within the JSON input. Comments are treated as invalid JSON if found and a is thrown.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.JsonCommentHandling.Skip
member.summary: Allow comments within the JSON input and ignore them. The will behave as if no comments were present.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.JsonCommentHandling.Allow
member.summary: Allow comments within the JSON input and treat them as valid tokens. While reading, the caller will be able to access the comment values.

member.summary: Creates a new exception object to relay error information to the user.

member.remarks: Note that the counts the number of bytes (i.e. UTF-8 code units) and not characters or scalars.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNode.Parse(System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader@,System.Nullable{System.Text.Json.Nodes.JsonNodeOptions})
member.summary: Parses one JSON value (including objects or arrays) from the provided reader.
member.param: The reader to read.
Options to control the behavior.
member.returns: The from the reader.

remarks.para: If the property of is or , the reader will be advanced by one call to to determine the start of the value.
Upon completion of this method, will be positioned at the final token in the JSON value. If an exception is thrown, the reader is reset to the state it was in when the method was called.
This method makes a copy of the data the reader acted on, so there is no caller requirement to maintain data integrity beyond the return of this method.

member.exception: is using unsupported options.
The current token does not start or represent a value.
A value could not be read from the reader.

member.summary: Tries to obtain the current JSON value and returns a value that indicates whether the operation succeeded.
member.remarks:
{T} can be the type or base type of the underlying value. If the underlying value is a then {T} can also be the type of any primitive value supported by current . Specifying the type for {T} will always succeed and return the underlying value as .
The underlying value of a after deserialization is an instance of , otherwise it's the value specified when the was created.
member.typeparam: The type of value to obtain.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the parsed value.
member.returns: if the value can be successfully obtained; otherwise, .

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.ConsumeNumberResult
member.summary: This enum captures the tri-state return value when trying to read a JSON number.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.ConsumeNumberResult.Success
member.summary: Reached a valid end of number and hence no action is required.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.ConsumeNumberResult.OperationIncomplete
member.summary: Successfully processed a portion of the number and need to read to the next region of the number.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.ConsumeNumberResult.NeedMoreData
member.summary: Observed incomplete data. Return false if we have more data to follow. Otherwise throw.

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.ConsumeTokenResult
member.summary: This enum captures the tri-state return value when trying to read the next JSON token.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.ConsumeTokenResult.Success
member.summary: Reached a valid end of token and hence no action is required.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.ConsumeTokenResult.NotEnoughDataRollBackState
member.summary: Observed incomplete data but progressed state partially in looking ahead. Return false and roll-back to a previously saved state.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.ConsumeTokenResult.IncompleteNoRollBackNecessary
member.summary: Observed incomplete data but no change was made to the state. Return false, but do not roll-back anything since nothing changed.

member.summary: Copies the UTF-8 code unit representation of this scalar to an output buffer. The buffer must be large enough to hold the required number of s.

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions
member.summary: Provides the ability for the user to define custom behavior when reading JSON.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions.CommentHandling
member.summary: Defines how the should handle comments when reading through the JSON.
member.exception: Thrown when the comment handling enum is set to a value that is not supported (i.e. not within the enum range).
member.remarks: By default is thrown if a comment is encountered.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions.MaxDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth allowed when reading JSON, with the default (i.e. 0) indicating a max depth of 64.
member.exception: Thrown when the max depth is set to a negative value.
member.remarks: Reading past this depth will throw a .

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions.AllowTrailingCommas
member.summary: Defines whether an extra comma at the end of a list of JSON values in an object or array is allowed (and ignored) within the JSON payload being read.
member.remarks: By default, it's set to false, and is thrown if a trailing comma is encountered.

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderState
member.summary: Defines an opaque type that holds and saves all the relevant state information which must be provided to the to continue reading after processing incomplete data. This type is required to support reentrancy when reading incomplete data, and to continue reading once more data is available. Unlike the , which is a ref struct, this type can survive across async/await boundaries and hence this type is required to provide support for reading in more data asynchronously before continuing with a new instance of the .

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderState.#ctor(System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: Defines the customized behavior of the that is different from the JSON RFC (for example how to handle comments or maximum depth allowed when reading). By default, the follows the JSON RFC strictly (i.e. comments within the JSON are invalid) and reads up to a maximum depth of 64.
member.remarks: An instance of this state must be passed to the ctor with the JSON data. Unlike the , which is a ref struct, the state can survive across async/await boundaries and hence this type is required to provide support for reading in more data asynchronously before continuing with a new instance of the .

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonReaderState.Options
member.summary: Gets the custom behavior when reading JSON using the that may deviate from strict adherence to the JSON specification, which is the default behavior.

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader
member.summary: Provides a high-performance API for forward-only, read-only access to the UTF-8 encoded JSON text. It processes the text sequentially with no caching and adheres strictly to the JSON RFC by default (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259). When it encounters invalid JSON, it throws a JsonException with basic error information like line number and byte position on the line. Since this type is a ref struct, it does not directly support async. However, it does provide support for reentrancy to read incomplete data, and continue reading once more data is presented. To be able to set max depth while reading OR allow skipping comments, create an instance of and pass that in to the reader.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSpan
member.summary: Gets the value of the last processed token as a ReadOnlySpan<byte> slice of the input payload. If the JSON is provided within a ReadOnlySequence<byte> and the slice that represents the token value fits in a single segment, then will contain the sliced value since it can be represented as a span. Otherwise, the will contain the token value.
member.remarks: If is true, contains useless data, likely for a previous single-segment token. Therefore, only access if is false. Otherwise, the token value must be accessed from .

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.BytesConsumed
member.summary: Returns the total amount of bytes consumed by the so far for the current instance of the with the given UTF-8 encoded input text.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.TokenStartIndex
member.summary: Returns the index that the last processed JSON token starts at within the given UTF-8 encoded input text, skipping any white space.
member.remarks: For JSON strings (including property names), this points to before the start quote. For comments, this points to before the first comment delimiter (i.e. '/').

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.CurrentDepth
member.summary: Tracks the recursive depth of the nested objects / arrays within the JSON text processed so far. This provides the depth of the current token.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.TokenType
member.summary: Gets the type of the last processed JSON token in the UTF-8 encoded JSON text.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.HasValueSequence
member.summary: Lets the caller know which of the two 'Value' properties to read to get the token value. For input data within a ReadOnlySpan<byte> this will always return false. For input data within a ReadOnlySequence<byte>, this will only return true if the token value straddles more than a single segment and hence couldn't be represented as a span.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueIsEscaped
member.summary: Lets the caller know whether the current or properties contain escape sequences per RFC 8259 section 7, and therefore require unescaping before being consumed.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.IsFinalBlock
member.summary: Returns the mode of this instance of the . True when the reader was constructed with the input span containing the entire data to process. False when the reader was constructed knowing that the input span may contain partial data with more data to follow.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueSequence
member.summary: Gets the value of the last processed token as a ReadOnlySpan<byte> slice of the input payload. If the JSON is provided within a ReadOnlySequence<byte> and the slice that represents the token value fits in a single segment, then will contain the sliced value since it can be represented as a span. Otherwise, the will contain the token value.
member.remarks: If is false, contains useless data, likely for a previous multi-segment token. Therefore, only access if is true. Otherwise, the token value must be accessed from .

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.Position
member.summary: Returns the current within the provided UTF-8 encoded input ReadOnlySequence<byte>. If the was constructed with a ReadOnlySpan<byte> instead, this will always return a default .

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.CurrentState
member.summary: Returns the current snapshot of the state which must be captured by the caller and passed back in to the ctor with more data. Unlike the , which is a ref struct, the state can survive across async/await boundaries and hence this type is required to provide support for reading in more data asynchronously before continuing with a new instance of the .

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.#ctor(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Boolean,System.Text.Json.JsonReaderState)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: The ReadOnlySpan<byte> containing the UTF-8 encoded JSON text to process.
True when the input span contains the entire data to process. Set to false only if it is known that the input span contains partial data with more data to follow.
If this is the first call to the ctor, pass in a default state. Otherwise, capture the state from the previous instance of the and pass that back.
member.remarks: Since this type is a ref struct, it is a stack-only type and all the limitations of ref structs apply to it. This is the reason why the ctor accepts a .

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.#ctor(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Text.Json.JsonReaderOptions)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance.
member.param: The ReadOnlySpan<byte> containing the UTF-8 encoded JSON text to process.

Defines the customized behavior of the that is different from the JSON RFC (for example how to handle comments or maximum depth allowed when reading). By default, the follows the JSON RFC strictly (i.e. comments within the JSON are invalid) and reads up to a maximum depth of 64.

remarks.para: Since this type is a ref struct, it is a stack-only type and all the limitations of ref structs apply to it.
This assumes that the entire JSON payload is passed in (equivalent to = true)

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.Read
member.summary: Read the next JSON token from input source.
member.returns: True if the token was read successfully, else false.
member.exception: Thrown when an invalid JSON token is encountered according to the JSON RFC or if the current depth exceeds the recursive limit set by the max depth.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.Skip
member.summary: Skips the children of the current JSON token.
member.exception: Thrown when the reader was given partial data with more data to follow (i.e. is false).
Thrown when an invalid JSON token is encountered while skipping, according to the JSON RFC, or if the current depth exceeds the recursive limit set by the max depth.
member.remarks:
When is , the reader first moves to the property value. When (originally, or after advancing) is or , the reader advances to the matching or .
For all other token types, the reader does not move. After the next call to , the reader will be at the next value (when in an array), the next property name (when in an object), or the end array/object token.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.TrySkip
member.summary: Tries to skip the children of the current JSON token.
member.returns: True if there was enough data for the children to be skipped successfully, else false.
member.exception: Thrown when an invalid JSON token is encountered while skipping, according to the JSON RFC, or if the current depth exceeds the recursive limit set by the max depth.

remarks.para: If the reader did not have enough data to completely skip the children of the current token, it will be reset to the state it was in before the method was called.

When is , the reader first moves to the property value. When (originally, or after advancing) is or , the reader advances to the matching or .
For all other token types, the reader does not move. After the next call to , the reader will be at the next value (when in an array), the next property name (when in an object), or the end array/object token.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueTextEquals(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte})
member.summary: Compares the UTF-8 encoded text to the unescaped JSON token value in the source and returns true if they match.
member.param: The UTF-8 encoded text to compare against.
member.returns: True if the JSON token value in the source matches the UTF-8 encoded look up text.
member.exception: Thrown if trying to find a text match on a JSON token that is not a string (i.e. other than or ).

remarks.para: If the look up text is invalid UTF-8 text, the method will return false since you cannot have invalid UTF-8 within the JSON payload.

The comparison of the JSON token value in the source and the look up text is done by first unescaping the JSON value in source, if required. The look up text is matched as is, without any modifications to it.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueTextEquals(System.String)
member.summary: Compares the string text to the unescaped JSON token value in the source and returns true if they match.
member.param: The text to compare against.
member.returns: True if the JSON token value in the source matches the look up text.
member.exception: Thrown if trying to find a text match on a JSON token that is not a string (i.e. other than or ).

remarks.para: If the look up text is invalid UTF-8 text, the method will return false since you cannot have invalid UTF-8 within the JSON payload.

The comparison of the JSON token value in the source and the look up text is done by first unescaping the JSON value in source, if required. The look up text is matched as is, without any modifications to it.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonReader.ValueTextEquals(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Char})
member.summary: Compares the text to the unescaped JSON token value in the source and returns true if they match.
member.param: The text to compare against.
member.returns: True if the JSON token value in the source matches the look up text.
member.exception: Thrown if trying to find a text match on a JSON token that is not a string (i.e. other than or ).

remarks.para: If the look up text is invalid or incomplete UTF-16 text (i.e. unpaired surrogates), the method will return false since you cannot have invalid UTF-16 within the JSON payload.

The comparison of the JSON token value in the source and the look up text is done by first unescaping the JSON value in source, if required. The look up text is matched as is, without any modifications to it.

remarks.para: If the property of is or , the reader will be advanced by one call to to determine the start of the value.
Upon completion of this method, will be positioned at the final token in the JSON value. If an exception is thrown, the reader is reset to the state it was in when the method was called.
This method makes a copy of the data the reader acted on, so there is no caller requirement to maintain data integrity beyond the return of this method.
The used to create the instance of the take precedence over the when they conflict. Hence, , , and are used while reading.

remarks.para: If the property of is or , the reader will be advanced by one call to to determine the start of the value.
Upon completion of this method, will be positioned at the final token in the JSON value. If an exception is thrown, the reader is reset to the state it was in when the method was called.
This method makes a copy of the data the reader acted on, so there is no caller requirement to maintain data integrity beyond the return of this method.

member.summary: Enumerable collections except dictionaries.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerDefaults.General
member.summary: Specifies that general-purpose values should be used. These are the same settings applied if a isn't specified.
member.remarks: This option implies that property names are treated as case-sensitive and that "PascalCase" name formatting should be employed.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerDefaults.Web
member.summary: Specifies that values should be used more appropriate to web-based scenarios.
member.remarks: This option implies that property names are treated as case-insensitive and that "camelCase" name formatting should be employed.

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.CachingContext
member.summary: Stores and manages all reflection caches for one or more instances. NB the type encapsulates the original options instance and only consults that one when building new types; this is to prevent multiple options instances from leaking into the object graphs of converters which could break user invariants.

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.TrackedCachingContexts
member.summary: Defines a cache of CachingContexts; instead of using a ConditionalWeakTable which can be slow to traverse this approach uses a fixed-size array of weak references of that can be looked up lock-free. Relevant caching contexts are looked up by linear traversal using the equality comparison defined by .

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.Default
member.summary: Gets a read-only, singleton instance of that uses the default configuration.
member.remarks: Each instance encapsulates its own serialization metadata caches, so using fresh default instances every time one is needed can result in redundant recomputation of converters. This property provides a shared instance that can be consumed by any number of components without necessitating any converter recomputation.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.TypeInfoResolver
member.summary: Gets or sets the contract resolver used by this instance.
member.exception: Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.
member.remarks: A setting is equivalent to using the reflection-based . The property will be populated automatically once used with one of the methods.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.AllowTrailingCommas
member.summary: Defines whether an extra comma at the end of a list of JSON values in an object or array is allowed (and ignored) within the JSON payload being deserialized.
member.exception: Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.
member.remarks: By default, it's set to false, and is thrown if a trailing comma is encountered.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.DefaultBufferSize
member.summary: The default buffer size in bytes used when creating temporary buffers.
member.remarks: The default size is 16K.
member.exception: Thrown when the buffer size is less than 1.
Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.Encoder
member.summary: The encoder to use when escaping strings, or to use the default encoder.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.DictionaryKeyPolicy
member.summary: Specifies the policy used to convert a key's name to another format, such as camel-casing.
member.remarks: This property can be set to to specify a camel-casing policy. It is not used when deserializing.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.IgnoreNullValues
member.summary: Determines whether null values are ignored during serialization and deserialization. The default value is false.
member.exception: Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred. or has been set to a non-default value. These properties cannot be used together.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.DefaultIgnoreCondition
member.summary: Specifies a condition to determine when properties with default values are ignored during serialization or deserialization. The default value is .
member.exception: Thrown if this property is set to .
Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred, or has been set to . These properties cannot be used together.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.NumberHandling
member.summary: Specifies how number types should be handled when serializing or deserializing.
member.exception: Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.IgnoreReadOnlyProperties
member.summary: Determines whether read-only properties are ignored during serialization. A property is read-only if it contains a public getter but not a public setter. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Read-only properties are not deserialized regardless of this setting.
member.exception: Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.IgnoreReadOnlyFields
member.summary: Determines whether read-only fields are ignored during serialization. A field is read-only if it is marked with the readonly keyword. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Read-only fields are not deserialized regardless of this setting.
member.exception: Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.IncludeFields
member.summary: Determines whether fields are handled on serialization and deserialization. The default value is false.
member.exception: Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.MaxDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth allowed when serializing or deserializing JSON, with the default (i.e. 0) indicating a max depth of 64.
member.exception: Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.
Thrown when the max depth is set to a negative value.
member.remarks: Going past this depth will throw a .

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.PropertyNamingPolicy
member.summary: Specifies the policy used to convert a property's name on an object to another format, such as camel-casing. The resulting property name is expected to match the JSON payload during deserialization, and will be used when writing the property name during serialization.
member.remarks: The policy is not used for properties that have a applied. This property can be set to to specify a camel-casing policy.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.PropertyNameCaseInsensitive
member.summary: Determines whether a property's name uses a case-insensitive comparison during deserialization. The default value is false.
member.remarks: There is a performance cost associated when the value is true.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.ReadCommentHandling
member.summary: Defines how the comments are handled during deserialization.
member.exception: Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.
Thrown when the comment handling enum is set to a value that is not supported (or not within the enum range).
member.remarks: By default is thrown if a comment is encountered.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.UnknownTypeHandling
member.summary: Defines how deserializing a type declared as an is handled during deserialization.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.WriteIndented
member.summary: Defines whether JSON should pretty print which includes: indenting nested JSON tokens, adding new lines, and adding white space between property names and values. By default, the JSON is serialized without any extra white space.
member.exception: Thrown if this property is set after serialization or deserialization has occurred.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonSerializerOptions.ReferenceHandler
member.summary: Configures how object references are handled when reading and writing JSON.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.WriteStack._indexOffset
member.summary: Offset used to derive the index of the current frame in the stack buffer from the current value of , following the formula currentIndex := _count - _indexOffset. Value can vary between 0 or 1 depending on whether we need to allocate a new frame on the first Push() operation, which can happen if the root converter is polymorphic.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.CancellationToken
member.summary: Cancellation token used by converters performing async serialization (e.g. IAsyncEnumerable)

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.SuppressFlush
member.summary: In the case of async serialization, used by resumable converters to signal that the current buffer contents should not be flushed to the underlying stream.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.PendingTask
member.summary: Stores a pending task that a resumable converter depends on to continue work. It must be awaited by the root context before serialization is resumed.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.CompletedAsyncDisposables
member.summary: List of completed IAsyncDisposables that have been scheduled for disposal by converters.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.FlushThreshold
member.summary: The amount of bytes to write before the underlying Stream should be flushed and the current buffer adjusted to remove the processed bytes.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.IsContinuation
member.summary: Indicates that the state still contains suspended frames waiting re-entry.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.IsPolymorphicRootValue
member.summary: Indicates that the root-level JsonTypeInfo is the result of polymorphic dispatch from the internal System.Object converter.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.SupportContinuation
member.summary: Internal flag to let us know that we need to read ahead in the inner read loop.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.SupportAsync
member.summary: Internal flag indicating that async serialization is supported. Implies `SupportContinuation`.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.NewReferenceId
member.summary: Stores a reference id that has been calculated for a newly serialized object.

member.name: F:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.PolymorphicTypeDiscriminator
member.summary: Indicates that the next converter is polymorphic and must serialize a type discriminator.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.CurrentContainsMetadata
member.summary: Whether the current frame needs to write out any metadata.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.PeekNestedJsonTypeInfo
member.summary: Gets the nested JsonTypeInfo before resolving any polymorphic converters

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.DisposePendingDisposablesOnException
member.summary: Walks the stack cleaning up any leftover IDisposables in the event of an exception on serialization

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.WriteStack.DisposePendingDisposablesOnExceptionAsync
member.summary: Walks the stack cleaning up any leftover I(Async)Disposables in the event of an exception on async serialization

member.remarks: For objects, it is either the actual (real) JsonPropertyInfo or the for the class. For collections, it is the for the class and current element.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.JsonWriterHelper.ToUtf8(System.ReadOnlySpan{System.Byte},System.Span{System.Byte},System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Converts a span containing a sequence of UTF-16 bytes into UTF-8 bytes.
This method will consume as many of the input bytes as possible.
On successful exit, the entire input was consumed and encoded successfully. In this case, will be equal to the length of the and will equal the total number of bytes written to the .
member.param: A span containing a sequence of UTF-16 bytes.
A span to write the UTF-8 bytes into.
On exit, contains the number of bytes that were consumed from the .
On exit, contains the number of bytes written to
member.returns: A value representing the state of the conversion.

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.JsonWriterOptions
member.summary: Provides the ability for the user to define custom behavior when writing JSON using the . By default, the JSON is written without any indentation or extra white space. Also, the will throw an exception if the user attempts to write structurally invalid JSON.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonWriterOptions.Encoder
member.summary: The encoder to use when escaping strings, or to use the default encoder.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonWriterOptions.Indented
member.summary: Defines whether the should pretty print the JSON which includes: indenting nested JSON tokens, adding new lines, and adding white space between property names and values. By default, the JSON is written without any extra white space.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonWriterOptions.MaxDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum depth allowed when writing JSON, with the default (i.e. 0) indicating a max depth of 1000.
member.exception: Thrown when the max depth is set to a negative value.
member.remarks: Reading past this depth will throw a .

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.JsonWriterOptions.SkipValidation
member.summary: Defines whether the should skip structural validation and allow the user to write invalid JSON, when set to true. If set to false, any attempts to write invalid JSON will result in a to be thrown.
member.remarks: If the JSON being written is known to be correct, then skipping validation (by setting it to true) could improve performance. An example of invalid JSON where the writer will throw (when SkipValidation is set to false) is when you write a value within a JSON object without a property name.

member.name: T:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter
member.summary: Provides a high-performance API for forward-only, non-cached writing of UTF-8 encoded JSON text.

remarks.para: It writes the text sequentially with no caching and adheres to the JSON RFC by default (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259), with the exception of writing comments.
When the user attempts to write invalid JSON and validation is enabled, it throws an with a context specific error message.
To be able to format the output with indentation and whitespace OR to skip validation, create an instance of and pass that in to the writer.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.BytesPending
member.summary: Returns the amount of bytes written by the so far that have not yet been flushed to the output and committed.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.BytesCommitted
member.summary: Returns the amount of bytes committed to the output by the so far.
member.remarks: In the case of IBufferwriter, this is how much the IBufferWriter has advanced. In the case of Stream, this is how much data has been written to the stream.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.Options
member.summary: Gets the custom behavior when writing JSON using the which indicates whether to format the output while writing and whether to skip structural JSON validation or not.

member.name: P:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.CurrentDepth
member.summary: Tracks the recursive depth of the nested objects / arrays within the JSON text written so far. This provides the depth of the current token.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.#ctor(System.Buffers.IBufferWriter{System.Byte},System.Text.Json.JsonWriterOptions)
member.summary: Constructs a new instance with a specified .
member.param: An instance of used as a destination for writing JSON text into.
Defines the customized behavior of the By default, the writes JSON minimized (that is, with no extra whitespace) and validates that the JSON being written is structurally valid according to JSON RFC.
member.exception: Thrown when the instance of that is passed in is null.

member.summary: Constructs a new instance with a specified .
member.param: An instance of used as a destination for writing JSON text into.
Defines the customized behavior of the By default, the writes JSON minimized (that is, with no extra whitespace) and validates that the JSON being written is structurally valid according to JSON RFC.
member.exception: Thrown when the instance of that is passed in is null.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.Reset
member.summary: Resets the internal state so that it can be re-used.
member.remarks: The will continue to use the original writer options and the original output as the destination (either or ).
member.exception: The instance of has been disposed.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.Reset(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Resets the internal state so that it can be re-used with the new instance of .
member.param: An instance of used as a destination for writing JSON text into.
member.remarks: The will continue to use the original writer options but now write to the passed in as the new destination.
member.exception: Thrown when the instance of that is passed in is null.
The instance of has been disposed.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.Reset(System.Buffers.IBufferWriter{System.Byte})
member.summary: Resets the internal state so that it can be re-used with the new instance of .
member.param: An instance of used as a destination for writing JSON text into.
member.remarks: The will continue to use the original writer options but now write to the passed in as the new destination.
member.exception: Thrown when the instance of that is passed in is null.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.Flush
member.summary: Commits the JSON text written so far which makes it visible to the output destination.
member.remarks: In the case of IBufferWriter, this advances the underlying based on what has been written so far. In the case of Stream, this writes the data to the stream and flushes it.
member.exception: The instance of has been disposed.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.Dispose
member.summary: Commits any left over JSON text that has not yet been flushed and releases all resources used by the current instance.

remarks.para: In the case of IBufferWriter, this advances the underlying based on what has been written so far. In the case of Stream, this writes the data to the stream and flushes it.
The instance cannot be re-used after disposing.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.DisposeAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously commits any left over JSON text that has not yet been flushed and releases all resources used by the current instance.

remarks.para: In the case of IBufferWriter, this advances the underlying based on what has been written so far. In the case of Stream, this writes the data to the stream and flushes it.
The instance cannot be re-used after disposing.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.FlushAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously commits the JSON text written so far which makes it visible to the output destination.
member.remarks: In the case of IBufferWriter, this advances the underlying based on what has been written so far. In the case of Stream, this writes the data to the stream and flushes it asynchronously, while monitoring cancellation requests.
member.exception: The instance of has been disposed.

member.name: M:System.Text.Json.Utf8JsonWriter.WriteRawValue(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Writes the input as JSON content. It is expected that the input content is a single complete JSON value.
member.param: The raw JSON content to write.
Whether to validate if the input is an RFC 8259-compliant JSON payload.
member.exception: Thrown if is .
Thrown if the length of the input is zero or greater than 715,827,882 ( / 3).
Thrown if is , and the input is not a valid, complete, single JSON value according to the JSON RFC (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8259) or the input JSON exceeds a recursive depth of 64.
member.remarks:
When writing untrused JSON values, do not set to as this can result in invalid JSON being written, and/or the overall payload being written to the writer instance being invalid.
When using this method, the input content will be written to the writer destination as-is, unless validation fails (when it is enabled).
The value for the writer instance is honored when using this method.
The and values for the writer instance are not applied when using this method.

member.name: T:System.Buffers.Text.SequenceValidity
member.summary: Represents the validity of a UTF code unit sequence.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.Text.SequenceValidity.Empty
member.summary: The sequence is empty.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.Text.SequenceValidity.WellFormed
member.summary: The sequence is well-formed and unambiguously represents a proper Unicode scalar value.
member.remarks: [ 20 ] (U+0020 SPACE) is a well-formed UTF-8 sequence. [ C3 A9 ] (U+00E9 LATIN SMALL LETTER E WITH ACUTE) is a well-formed UTF-8 sequence. [ F0 9F 98 80 ] (U+1F600 GRINNING FACE) is a well-formed UTF-8 sequence. [ D83D DE00 ] (U+1F600 GRINNING FACE) is a well-formed UTF-16 sequence.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.Text.SequenceValidity.Incomplete
member.summary: The sequence is not well-formed on its own, but it could appear as a prefix of a longer well-formed sequence. More code units are needed to make a proper determination as to whether this sequence is well-formed. Incomplete sequences can only appear at the end of a string.
member.remarks: [ C2 ] is an incomplete UTF-8 sequence if it is followed by nothing. [ F0 9F ] is an incomplete UTF-8 sequence if it is followed by nothing. [ D83D ] is an incomplete UTF-16 sequence if it is followed by nothing.

member.name: F:System.Buffers.Text.SequenceValidity.Invalid
member.summary: The sequence is never well-formed anywhere, or this sequence can never appear as a prefix of a longer well-formed sequence, or the sequence was improperly terminated by the code unit which appeared immediately after this sequence.
member.remarks: [ 80 ] is an invalid UTF-8 sequence (code unit cannot appear at start of sequence). [ FE ] is an invalid UTF-8 sequence (sequence is never well-formed anywhere in UTF-8 string). [ C2 ] is an invalid UTF-8 sequence if it is followed by [ 20 ] (sequence improperly terminated). [ ED A0 ] is an invalid UTF-8 sequence (sequence is never well-formed anywhere in UTF-8 string). [ DE00 ] is an invalid UTF-16 sequence (code unit cannot appear at start of sequence).

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DynamicallyAccessedMembersAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that certain members on a specified are accessed dynamically, for example through .
member.remarks:
This allows tools to understand which members are being accessed during the execution of a program.
This attribute is valid on members whose type is or .
When this attribute is applied to a location of type , the assumption is that the string represents a fully qualified type name.
When this attribute is applied to a class, interface, or struct, the members specified can be accessed dynamically on instances returned from calling on instances of that class, interface, or struct.
If the attribute is applied to a method it's treated as a special case and it implies the attribute should be applied to the "this" parameter of the method. As such the attribute should only be used on instance methods of types assignable to System.Type (or string, but no methods will use it there).

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute
member.summary: Suppresses reporting of a specific rule violation, allowing multiple suppressions on a single code artifact.
member.remarks: is different than in that it doesn't have a . So it is always preserved in the compiled assembly.

member.name: M:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, specifying the category of the tool and the identifier for an analysis rule.
member.param: The category for the attribute.
The identifier of the analysis rule the attribute applies to.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Category
member.summary: Gets the category identifying the classification of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property describes the tool or tool analysis category for which a message suppression attribute applies.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.CheckId
member.summary: Gets the identifier of the analysis tool rule to be suppressed.
member.remarks: Concatenated together, the and properties form a unique check identifier.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Scope
member.summary: Gets or sets the scope of the code that is relevant for the attribute.
member.remarks: The Scope property is an optional argument that specifies the metadata scope for which the attribute is relevant.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Target
member.summary: Gets or sets a fully qualified path that represents the target of the attribute.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument identifying the analysis target of the attribute. An example value is "System.IO.Stream.ctor():System.Void". Because it is fully qualified, it can be long, particularly for targets such as parameters. The analysis tool user interface should be capable of automatically formatting the parameter.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.MessageId
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional argument expanding on exclusion criteria.
member.remarks: The property is an optional argument that specifies additional exclusion where the literal metadata target is not sufficiently precise. For example, the cannot be applied within a method, and it may be desirable to suppress a violation against a statement in the method that will give a rule violation, but not against all statements in the method.

member.name: P:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.UnconditionalSuppressMessageAttribute.Justification
member.summary: Gets or sets the justification for suppressing the code analysis message.
